medical_history.chief_complaint: 4 days of malaise, decreased PO intake, nausea, vomiting, and right-sided abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4 days prior to admission, with malaise, decreased oral intake, nausea, vomiting, and right-sided abdominal pain. The patient has a history of gallstone pancreatitis and underwent PCT 1 month prior to admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypothyroidism, Dyslipidemia; History of gallstone pancreatitis s/p PCT.
medical_history.family_history: Notable for pancreatic cancer in 2 first-degree relatives.
